author: Associated Press
title: NHL: Canadiens keep Penguins winless
text:
NHL: Canadiens keep Penguins winless Associated Press Posted: 10/13/2015 09:36:31 PM PDT Updated: 10/13/2015 10:44:43 PM PDT tuesday's HIGHLIGHTS Canadiens 3, Penguins 2: Tomas Fleischmann finished an odd-man rush with his first goal of the season early in the third period as unbeaten Montreal kept Pittsburgh winless. 
Stars 4, Oilers. 2: Jason Spezza scored three goals, including the tiebreaker late in the third period in the Dallas win. Edmonton rookie Connor McDavid, the top pick in the draft, scored his first goal. 
Predators 3, Devils 1: Pekka Rinne made 22 saves, and Nashville ran its season-opening winning streak to three. The Predators are off to their best start since 2010-11. 
Panthers 4, Hurricanes 1: Connor Brickley scored his first NHL goal, and Alexsander Barkov gave Florida a two-goal lead 50 seconds later in the third period. 
Jets 4, Rangers 1: Brian Little scored twice as Winnipeg beat New York to finish 3-1-0 in its opening trip. 
Red Wings 3, Lightning 1: Henrik Zetterberg had a goal and an assist, and Jimmy Howard made 20 saves as Detroit improved to 3-0-0. 
Blues 4, Flames 3: Colton Parayko scored his first two NHL goals to lead St. Louis over Calgary. The 22-year-old defenseman broke a 2-2 tie at 4:47 of the second period on a 55-foot wrist shot that eluded Flames goaltender Jonas Hiller. 
Canucks 3, Kings 0: Ryan Miller posted his 36th career shutout, and Vancouver completed a Southern California sweep. The Canucks, who beat Anaheim on Monday, are 3-0-1. -- ASSOCIATED PRESS
